definition: to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey

sentences.english: The enzymes detoxify the carcinogens, and are among the strongest cancer fighting substances available.
sentences.chinese: 生化酶可分解致癌物質，並在最強抗癌物質中使用。

sentences.english: Both snuff and chewing tobacco contain deadly carcinogens.
sentences.chinese: 鼻菸和口嚼煙都含有致癌物質。

sentences.english: Frying in vegetable oil results in carcinogenic substances due to burned oil.
sentences.chinese: 在煮過的植物油中煎炸東西，會產生致癌物質。

sentences.english: Cankered material can produce effluvial carcinogen aldehyde . 2.
sentences.chinese: 腐爛的物質可以產生惡臭的致癌物質乙醛。

sentences.english: He does say the carcinogen cadmium is no longer in use.
sentences.chinese: 不過他說，致癌物質鎘已經不再使用。

sentences.english: Sudan red is believed to cause cancer.
sentences.chinese: 蘇丹紅被認爲是一種致癌物質。

sentences.english: Formaldehyde is a suspected carcinogen linked to nasal and lung cancer.
sentences.chinese: 甲醛一直被懷疑是導致鼻癌及肺癌的致癌物質。

sentences.english: K. Sudan red is believed to cause cancer.
sentences.chinese: 蘇丹紅被認爲是一種致癌物質。

sentences.english: Chronic exposure to toxic carcinogens are known to bio-accumulate.
sentences.chinese: 長期接觸有毒的致癌物質已知會導致生物積累。

sentences.english: Colorings used in sodas are cancer-causing.
sentences.chinese: 汽水中使用的染色劑也是一種致癌物質。

sentences.english: But some experts say that cancer-causing substances can be produced if cooking oil is heated repeatedly.
sentences.chinese: 但一些專家說如煎炸油反覆加熱將產生致癌物質。

sentences.english: Thiourea powder is a known cancer causing material.
sentences.chinese: 硫脲粉是已知的致癌物質。

definition: stress/abbr. for 應激反應|应激反应[ying4 ji1 fan3 ying4]
